Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたの、<Annie>？ 元気がなさそうだけど。
Entry.EnglishText: What's the matter, <Annie>? You look kinda down.

Entry.JapaneseText: だってこの町……ガジュマしかいないし…… 息苦しいっていうか、落ち着かないっていうか……
Entry.EnglishText: Well... There are only Gajuma in this town... I find it stifling, and I can't relax...

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん、そういう時は……おまじないだネ！ ちちんぷいぷい！ こういえば、元気になれるよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Well I have a little something for times like these... A magic spell! Firekazam! Say that, and you'll feel better!
Entry.Notes: Chichinpuipui is said when parent's comfort a child i.e. pain pain go away but Mao...does not use it like that.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちちん……ぷいぷい…… ちちんぷいぷい……
どう？ 少しは元気になった？
<Mao>、それは火をつける時の おまじないじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>, isn't that the spell you use to set things on fire?

Entry.JapaneseText: しーッ！ ナイショナイショ……！
